description: Hillary Rodham Clinton is now viewed more favorably and as a stronger leader than she was earlier in the year despite weeks of scrutiny about her ethics, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.
title: A New York Times/CBS News Poll on the 2016 Presidential Campaign and the Issues
title_page: A New York Times/CBS News Poll on the 2016 Presidential Campaign and the Issues - The New York Times
text:
How the New York Times/CBS News Poll Was Conducted
The New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted April 30 to May 3 with 1,027 adults throughout the United States. Of these, 868 said they were registered to vote.
